intro: Timonius whiteanus, commonly known as the White's timonius, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has a slender, upright stem with lance-shaped leaves. Its blooming period occurs during the late spring and early summer months. Due to habitat loss, Timonius whiteanus is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation programs.
